procedure.step1: Finely chop the onion, garlic, and carrot.
procedure.step2: In a wide pot, place the oil and garlic while cold, then turn on to medium-low heat.
procedure.step3: When the oil is hot, add the onion, carrot, and a pinch of salt to help draw out moisture; sauté for 6-7 minutes, stirring often, making sure not to burn the garlic.
procedure.step4: Add the tomato passata and a bit of water to rinse the bottle and get all the remaining passata; then add salt and sugar.
procedure.step5: Once it reaches a boil, lower the heat to a minimum, cover with a lid slightly ajar, and cook for 35–40 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add water if needed.

notes.tomato: * Prefer a passata without added sugar, of good quality.
notes.time: ** Longer cooking time makes the sauce thicker and richer.
